verses.kjv: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him to Pilate.
verses.web: Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, bound Jesus, carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.
verses.ct: At dawn, the chief priests met with the elders, the scribes, and the entire council. They bound Jesus, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.

verses.kjv: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering said unto him, Thou sayest it.
verses.web: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered, “So you say.”
verses.ct: Pilate asked him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus replied, "You have said it yourself."

verses.kjv: And the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.
verses.web: The chief priests accused him of many things.
verses.ct: The chief priests piled accusation after accusation against him, but Jesus said nothing in response.

verses.kjv: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.
verses.web: Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!”
verses.ct: Pilate questioned him again: "Don't you have anything to say? Look at how many charges they're bringing against you!"

verses.kjv: But Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.
verses.web: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled.
verses.ct: But Jesus still didn't answer, which amazed Pilate.

verses.kjv: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.
verses.web: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.
verses.ct: Now it was customary during the festival for the governor to release one prisoner — whichever one the crowd requested.

verses.kjv: And there was one named Barabbas, which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him, who had committed murder in the insurrection.
verses.web: There was one called Barabbas, bound with his fellow insurgents, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.
verses.ct: A man named Barabbas was in prison along with other rebels who had committed murder during an uprising.

verses.kjv: And the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them.
verses.web: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.
verses.ct: The crowd came forward and began asking Pilate to follow his usual custom of releasing a prisoner.

verses.kjv: But Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
verses.web: Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
verses.ct: Pilate responded, "Do you want me to release the King of the Jews to you?"

verses.kjv: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.
verses.web: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.
verses.ct: He could tell that the chief priests had handed Jesus over because they were jealous of him.

verses.kjv: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.
verses.web: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead.
verses.ct: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to demand that Pilate release Barabbas instead.

verses.kjv: And Pilate answered and said again unto them, What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?
verses.web: Pilate again asked them, “What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?”
verses.ct: Pilate asked them again, "Then what do you want me to do with the man you call the King of the Jews?"

verses.kjv: And they cried out again, Crucify him.
verses.web: They cried out again, “Crucify him!”
verses.ct: They shouted back, "Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: Then Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, Crucify him.
verses.web: Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they cried out exceedingly, “Crucify him!”
verses.ct: "Why? What crime has he committed?" Pilate asked. But they only screamed louder, "Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.
verses.web: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.
verses.ct: Wanting to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. Then he had Jesus flogged and handed him over to be crucified.

verses.kjv: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.
verses.web: The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort.
verses.ct: The soldiers led Jesus into the courtyard of the governor's headquarters, called the Praetorium, and assembled the entire cohort around him.

verses.kjv: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head,
verses.web: They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
verses.ct: They dressed him in a purple robe, twisted together a crown of thorns, and pressed it onto his head.

verses.kjv: And began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!
verses.web: They began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.ct: Then they began mocking him with salutes: "Hail, King of the Jews!"

verses.kjv: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.
verses.web: They struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him.
verses.ct: They beat him on the head with a stick, spit on him, and dropped to their knees in fake worship.

verses.kjv: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.
verses.web: When they had mocked him, they took the purple off him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.
verses.ct: When they were done mocking him, they stripped off the purple robe, put his own clothes back on him, and led him out to be crucified.

verses.kjv: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.
verses.web: They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.
verses.ct: A man named Simon from Cyrene — the father of Alexander and Rufus — was passing by on his way in from the countryside. The soldiers forced him to carry Jesus' cross.

verses.kjv: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.
verses.web: They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, “The place of a skull.”
verses.ct: They brought Jesus to a place called Golgotha, which means "The Place of the Skull."

verses.kjv: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.
verses.web: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn’t take it.
verses.ct: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he refused to drink it.

verses.kjv: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.
verses.web: Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.
verses.ct: After they crucified him, the soldiers divided up his clothes by casting lots to see who would get each piece.

verses.kjv: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.
verses.web: It was the third hour, and they crucified him.
verses.ct: It was 9 in the morning when they crucified him.

verses.kjv: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.web: The superscription of his accusation was written over him, “THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.ct: A sign was posted above him stating the charge against him: THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.kjv: And with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.
verses.web: With him they crucified two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.
verses.ct: They also crucified 2 criminals with him — one on his right and one on his left.

verses.kjv: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.
verses.web: The Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was counted with transgressors.”
verses.ct: This fulfilled the Scripture that says, "He was counted with transgressors."

verses.kjv: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,
verses.web: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads, and saying, “Ha! You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days,
verses.ct: People walking by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads and saying, "Ha! You who were going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in 3 days —

verses.kjv: Save thyself, and come down from the cross.
verses.web: save yourself, and come down from the cross!”
verses.ct: save yourself and come down from the cross!"

verses.kjv: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.
verses.web: Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said, “He saved others. He can’t save himself.
verses.ct: The chief priests and scribes mocked him the same way among themselves: "He saved others, but he can't save himself.

verses.kjv: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reviled him.
verses.web: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him.” Those who were crucified with him also insulted him.
verses.ct: Let this 'Christ,' this 'King of Israel,' come down from the cross right now so we can see it and believe!" Even the men crucified alongside him hurled insults at him.

verses.kjv: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.web: When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.ct: At noon, darkness fell over the entire land and lasted until 3 in the afternoon.

verses.kjv: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
verses.web: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is, being interpreted, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
verses.ct: At 3 in the afternoon, Jesus cried out in a loud voice, "Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?" — which means, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"

verses.kjv: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.
verses.web: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he is calling Elijah.”
verses.ct: Some of the bystanders heard him and said, "Listen — he's calling for Elijah."

verses.kjv: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.
verses.web: One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down.”
verses.ct: One man ran and soaked a sponge in sour wine, stuck it on a stick, and held it up for Jesus to drink. "Leave him alone," he said. "Let's see if Elijah comes to take him down."

verses.kjv: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
verses.web: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.
verses.ct: Then Jesus let out a loud cry and breathed his last.

verses.kjv: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.
verses.web: The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom.
verses.ct: At that moment, the curtain in the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.

verses.kjv: And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
verses.web: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”
verses.ct: The Roman centurion standing right across from Jesus saw how he died and said, "Truly, this man was the Son of God!"

verses.kjv: There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
verses.web: There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
verses.ct: A group of women watched from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and Joses, and Salome.

verses.kjv: (Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.
verses.web: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him and served him; and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: These women had followed Jesus and served him when he was in Galilee. Many other women who had traveled with him to Jerusalem were there as well.

verses.kjv: And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
verses.web: When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
verses.ct: That evening — since it was Preparation Day, the day before the Sabbath —

verses.kjv: Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.
verses.web: Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for God’s Kingdom, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.ct: Joseph of Arimathaea, a respected member of the council who was himself waiting for God's Kingdom, gathered his courage, went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus' body.

verses.kjv: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.
verses.web: Pilate marveled if he were already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he had been dead long.
verses.ct: Pilate was surprised that Jesus could already be dead. He summoned the centurion and asked if Jesus had been dead for long.

verses.kjv: And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
verses.web: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.
verses.ct: Once the centurion confirmed it, Pilate released the body to Joseph.

verses.kjv: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
verses.web: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
verses.ct: Joseph bought a linen cloth, took the body down from the cross, wrapped it in the cloth, and placed it in a tomb that had been carved out of rock. Then he rolled a stone across the entrance.

verses.kjv: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
verses.web: Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.
verses.ct: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses watched carefully and saw where he was laid.
